title: Émile Durkheim
summary: David Émile Durkheim (French: [emil dyʁkɛm] or [dyʁkajm];[2] 15 April 1858 – 15 November 1917) was a French sociologist. He formally established the academic discipline of sociology and, with Max Weber, and Karl Marx, is commonly cited as the principal architect of modern social science.[3][4]
